frames.input

Class GrabberObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • frames.input.GrabberObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Grabber

    public abstract class GrabberObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Grabber
    Grabber object which eases third-party implementation of the Grabber interface.

    Based on the concrete event type, this model object splits the track(Event) and the interact(Event) methods into more specific versions of them, e.g., track(TapEvent), track(MotionEvent3), interact(MotionEvent6) , interact(KeyEvent) and so on. Thus allowing implementations of this abstract GrabberObject to override only those method signatures that might be of their interest.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GrabberObject(Agent agent)
      Constructs and adds this grabber to the agent pool.
      GrabberObject(InputHandler inputHandler)
      Constructs and adds this grabber to all agents belonging to the inputGrabber handler.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean grabsInput(Agent agent)
      Check if this object is the Agent.inputGrabber() .
      boolean grabsInput(InputHandler inputHandler)
      Checks if the frame grabs inputGrabber from any agent registered at the given inputGrabber handler.
      void interact(Event event)
      Defines how the grabber should react according to the given event.
      boolean track(Event event)
      Defines the rules to set the grabber as an agent inputGrabber-grabber.
      boolean track(MotionEvent motionEvent)
      Calls track() on the proper motion event: MotionEvent1, MotionEvent2, MotionEvent3 or MotionEvent6.

    • Method Detail

      • grabsInput

        public boolean grabsInput(Agent agent)
        Check if this object is the Agent.inputGrabber() . Returns true if this object grabs the agent and false otherwise.

      • grabsInput

        public boolean track(Event event)

      • track

        public boolean track(MotionEvent motionEvent)
        Calls track() on the proper motion event: MotionEvent1, MotionEvent2, MotionEvent3 or MotionEvent6.

        Override this method when you want the object to be picked from a KeyEvent.
